ingredients: 2 Tbsp olive oil or vegetable oil
2 cans (15 oz each) white beans (cannellini or Great Northern), drained and rinsed (or 3.5 cups cooked beans)
(Optional) 1 ají amarillo pepper or jalapeño, minced
steps: Heat oil in a large skillet or saucepan over medium heat
Add onion and cook until softened and translucent (5-7 min)
Add garlic, cumin, paprika, and turmeric; cook until fragrant (~1 min)
Add optional ají amarillo or jalapeño if using
Add beans, broth, salt, pepper, and bay leaf. Stir to combine

Bring to a simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until liquid reduces and beans are creamy (10-15 min). Lightly mash some beans against the side of the pan for a creamier texture
Remove bay leaf. Taste and adjust seasoning
Optionally stir in fresh cilantro and lime juice before serving
title: Peruvian-Style White Beans
